subs.text: September 2022
subs.name: september2022

subs.text: September 13

New iPhone feature. This is cool. In class we used use keynote or online services to cut out images. This is even simpler. No need for green screen. Works on my 4yr old phone. Hope it comes to iPadOS. [link]
subs.rawText: New iPhone feature. This is cool. In class we used use keynote or online services to cut out images. This is even simpler. No need for green screen. Works on my 4yr old phone. Hope it comes to iPadOS. https://t.co/G3vSQQrg2e

subs.text: September 12
Running through my camera roll now iOS 16 installed. Impressed with the lookup of birds & insects that has been added to flora.
subs.rawText: Running through my camera roll now iOS 16 installed. Impressed with the lookup of birds & insects that has been added to flora.

subs.text: September 11

@Mr_Minchin I used Minecraft during lockdown when teaching remotely. Can turn on text to speech and listen to chat which can be amusing: [link] I also had pupils teach me remotely via text, screenshots and video: https://t.co/n9MK9Dq6Fp Which was delightful
subs.rawText:
@Mr_Minchin I used Minecraft during lockdown when teaching remotely. Can turn on text to speech and listen to chat which can be amusing:
https://t.co/GIZ8HMDzWi

I also had pupils teach me remotely via text, screenshots and video:
https://t.co/n9MK9Dq6Fp
Which was delightful

subs.text: I saw this map made by Artist Amanda Thompson, @passingplace & though I might repurpose some of my walk maps. With help from leaflet & examples I made the above from 60 gpx tracks. The most tedious part was exporting the tracks from Trails, 1 by 1! [link]
subs.rawText:
I saw this map made by Artist Amanda Thompson, @passingplace & though I might repurpose some of my walk maps. With help from leaflet & examples I made the above from 60 gpx tracks. The most tedious part was exporting the tracks from Trails, 1 by 1!
https://t.co/t2ogXo36HU

subs.text: @ronald_2008 Sounds right. Too cold for fireflies here. I've never seen one.
subs.rawText: @ronald_2008 Sounds right. Too cold for fireflies here. I've never seen one.

subs.text: September 10
Quite a few smaller dragonflies & damselflies around Ardinning today. Nice sunny morning, autumn feels close, bracken & heather turning. [link]
subs.rawText: Quite a few smaller dragonflies &amp; damselflies around Ardinning today. Nice sunny morning, autumn feels close, bracken &amp; heather turning. https://t.co/JcRU3jgrle

subs.text: I‚Äôve been blogging & thinking about software in education for a while. One of the biggest changes in what I read has been the increase in out of the box solutions & a decrease in bending things in unexpected ways. I am more interested in the latter. ... [link]
subs.rawText: I‚Äôve been blogging & thinking about software in education for a while. One of the biggest changes in what I read has been the increase in out of the box solutions & a decrease in bending things in unexpected ways. I am more interested in the latter. ... https://t.co/wxnAOMJ1jh

subs.text: September 9

Read: Small Things Like These by Claire Keegan üìö  ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ
A beautiful wee book that drew me in quietly & has stuck in my mind. Ireland 1985, A gentle slightly troubled man digs deep. ‚ÄúHunters in the Snow‚Äù on the cover seems fitting as the village approaches a snowy Christmas.

subs.text: September 8

I just got a Badger 2040 on a bit of a whim. A hackable, programmable badge with E Ink¬Æ display, powered by Raspberry Pi RP2040. I‚Äôve only followed the basic tutorials so far & don‚Äôt know python but I think this could be an interesting wee device. [link] https://t.co/7dnuH7Pn9v
